column4: In Ubuntu 9.10 when I'm scaling a window I don't want to see an orange transparent symbol of what the new size will look like, I just want the window to scale there automatically, a la Mac OS X. What can I do to fix this, do I need CompizConfig because I have it.
yeah, it's in compizconfig: go look at the resize plugin :)
Maletor is not a command as far as I know. I did try umount -f
Read the man page about what umount -l does though.
-l  is lazy un mount.  It's in the man page.  It says "unmount when you're ready"  The fs unmounts itself.
It usually works for me too when a fs is "busy"  :)
Perhaps you can and no program can be run again.
Then why would opening terminal say: there was an error creating child process for this terminal
christ. and that means i can't dissasemble my raid because it can't even get bash let along mdadm
what's the process for mounting my drives on the live cd and starting up the raid over there. last time i tried to `mount /dev/sda /mnt/sda` it didn't work...
I don't know how to set up raid :(  Never done it!
